definition[0]: if a sound echoes, you hear it again because it was made near something such as a wall or hill
example[0]: The sound of an engine echoed back from the thick forest.
example[1]: He could hear eerie noises echoing through the corridors.
definition[1]: if a place echoes, it is filled with sounds that are repeated or are similar to each other
example[2]: The house echoed with the sound of children’s voices.
definition[2]: to repeat what someone else has just said
example[3]: ‘You bet, ’ she said, echoing his words.
definition[3]: to repeat an idea or opinion because you agree with it
example[4]: The article simply echoed the NRA’s arguments against gun control.
definition[4]: a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near something such as a wall
example[5]: Her scream was followed by a loud echo.
definition[5]: something that is very similar to something that has happened or been said before
example[6]: This idea finds an echo in many African countries.
example[7]: The article contains echoes of an earlier report.
